div.div: Learning Forward and the National Commission on Teaching & America’s Future (NCTAF) today announced 12 finalists in its Agents for Learning challenge, a nationwide call to action designed to engage educator teams in advocating for the best use of federal funding for professional learning under the Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA) - See more at: http://www.boyd.kyschools.us/News/11754#sthash.cewAUZGa.L8jbI65m.dpuf

b.span: All Boyd County schools have earned reaccreditation with

strong.span: Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Council on Accreditation and School Improvement (SACS CASI), an accreditation division of AdvancED.

p.span: Boyd County Public Schools has been accredited since 2009.

span.strong: BCHS Key will be recognized for receiving The Distinguished Club-Diamond Club-Diamond Level Award at the International Convention & Leadership Conference in Baltimore, MD in July 2019.
Boyd County Foundation For Children, Inc. Grants Awarded for 2019 - 2020 School Year:

p.span:
Nancy Adams/Kevin Pence, Ponderosa, Rock Garden
Krista All, Catlettsburg Elementary, Be Calm, be focused; ready, set and LEARN!
Kathy Felty, Ramey Estep High School, Sew Much Fun
Steve Grannis, Ramey Estep High School, Small Scale Hydroponic Production of Winter Salad Greens
Anita Griffith/Peggy Hughes, Ramey Estep High School, Appalachian Rewind
Annie Johnson, District-wide Production, Oliver Twist
John Johnson/Aaron Bowling, BCHS, Lion Recording Studio
Mary Leigh Lewis, BCHS, Boyd County Science Camp 2019 or 2020
Abigail Maynard, BCHS, Rocketbook to the Rescue
Dinah Penick/Christy Reliford, BCMS, SRA Corrective Reading Program
Tanya Queen (Preschool Teachers), ECLC, Family Involvement is FUNdamental!
Lisa Selvage, Catlettsburg, Climb into Learning
Jordan Stevens/Kylie Haywood, Summit, Taking Action to Limit Distraction
Lisa Wiler, Boyd County Gifted Education, Makerspace Lab

hr.p: In following with Governor Beshear’s recommendation that all Kentucky schools continue NTI for the remainder of the school year, each school must collect already completed NTI work as well as distribute the final round of new NTI assignments. This will be done under the guidance of each school using the following schedule:

p.strong: NTI Pick-up (Day 35-43) Wednesday 4/29 and Thursday 4/30 from
NTI drop-off (Day 5-9) and pick-up (Day 35-43) Wednesday 4/29 from 8:30-11:30am, and 3-6pm

span.strong: The schools below will pick up any work that has been completed beginning with NTI Day 5 and will be passing out work for NTI Day 35-43

p.strong: NTI drop-off and pick-up Thursday 4/30 from 9-11:30am, and 3-6pm
NTI drop-off and pick-up Thursday 4/30 from 9-11:30am, and 3-6pm
NTI drop-off and pick-up Friday 5/1 from 9-11:30am, and 3-6pm
NTI drop-off and pick-up Monday 5/4 from 9-11:30am, and 3-6pm

hr.p: Much of the work your child has completed has likely been submitted electronically. Any paper assignments being turned in must be labeled with the following information:

For the safety of you and your family, any new NTI work that is being distributed has been stored in isolation for five days before being provided to students on the dates above as directed by the Boyd County Health Department.

As always, our district remains committed to the needs of your children and are here to assist in any way we can. Please reach out to me or child’s principal, counselor, or teacher if you have any questions.

p.strong: On April 20, 2020, Governor Beshear gave the recommendation that all Kentucky schools continue Non-Traditional Instruction (NTI) for the remainder of the school year. In order to complete the 1,062 instructional hours required by law, Boyd County Public Schools will continue NTI through Thursday, May 14, 2020. This will mark the last day for students for the 2019-2020 school year.

Additional information regarding dates for technology return, locker clean-out, grade postings, etc. will be made available next week. BCPS has set a graduation ceremony date for Saturday, May 16th, at 2:00 pm with an inclement weather day for Sunday, May 17th, at 2:00 pm. More information on the ceremony will be given later next week.

As you know, these last few weeks have been difficult for everyone. Like you, I am disappointed with the loss of in-class instruction time, spring events, spring sports, and most of all the loss of the concluding traditions for our seniors.

Our district remains committed to the needs of your children and are here to assist you in any way we can. Please feel free to reach out to me or your child’s principal, counselor, or teacher if you are in need of assistance.
